title: Worlds Casting (not really either gameplay/strategy or help/support)
body:
Anyone know the process/logistics of casting at worlds?   Obviously, so that the audience experience is maximised; {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}} there can't be any significant delay, and the shoutcasters must be audible: the audio definitely indicates that they're pretty loud, which makes sense - commentary **makes** watching sport.  
However, obviously, the casters need to be able to commentate on:
> objectives that are being taken which, of course, the opponent **should** know is being taken, but don't know when they're started

> potential ganks/ambushes

> etc.

Do the summoners simply have incredible noise-cancelling headphones?  Is it that simple?  Am I merely a cynical Cho'Gath/Ekko main who doesn't believe in headphones/~~hasn't ever really had top-quality noise-cancelling headphones~~?  Or is there something more that I just don't understand, being stranded here in OCE and not being able to get to an OPL final?
Rito pls, fulfil my curiosity

replies.body: I always just assumes that there was a delay between the game and the stream/live viewing.
They play static noise through the NC headphones to block out the crowd and the casters. At big events many players have reported hearing the crowd, but I haven't heard of anyone hearing the casters.
